title: Strictly star Emma Weymouth's husband 'erupted in fury' after she was in bottom two
text:

Viscountess Emma Weymouth was in the bottom two in last weekend's Strictly Come Dancing , which reportedly made her husband "furious".

Posh Ceawlin Thynn, Viscount Weymouth, had to be "calmed down" backstage as his wife came dangerously close to being the third person to be voted out of the competition.

He became agitated while watching the show on a TV monitor, it's claimed.

A source told The Sun : "He was hopping mad — it made a real scene. Everyone had had a few drinks so the volume levels were high.

"When Emma joined him she seemed to be desperately trying to calm him down. It was rather awkward."

(Image: Dave Benett/Getty Images for Ser)

It's claimed that his anger was triggered by a fault with the TV feed.

Fortunately, Emma and her partner Aljaz Skorjanec were saved by all four of the judges.

They were in the middle of the leaderboard with their jive to Kids in America but fell to the bottom two after the public vote.

(Image: PA)

They'd been in the dance off with Dev Griffin and his dancing partner Dianne Buswell, who were sent home.

The judges' decision not to save Dev and Dianne sparked outrage amongst Strictly viewers.

Many have been threatening to boycott the show as they claim they didn't deserve to leave.

It also came as a shock the pair, with Dianne admitting she was "devastated" by their early exit.

She said she promised Dev he was 'going to be fine' because of the judges comments to them earlier in the night.

Both Craig Revel Horwood and head judge Shirley Ballas had initially expressed their complete surprise at Dev even being in the bottom two.
